answers.answer: I first want to say I'm sorry for your ordeal. But I'm glad you and your baby are doing good. Sounds good for Joshua. I will keep you two in my prayers. He's gaining weight and that is REALLY good. God bless you!

Firstly congratulations on you baby.  I have a Joshua too.  I am sorry that both you and Joshua had to go through all that but sounds like he is a fighter and will be home with you soon.  Wishing you all the best and make sure you jeep us updated.

congrats on your little guy.i had an eclampsic seizure after my c-section with my son 6 weeks ago. i was put on Magnesium Sulfate too. That stuff SUCKS!!!! I had to have it for 24 hours (i'm pretty sure- if it wasn't 24 hours it sure as heck felt like it). By the end of that I was biting the nurses heads off- not too effectively either because I was so dang tired. Sorry to hear you had an ordeal but I'm sure little Joshua is more than worth the trouble. I know Conner is. :o)
Congrats to you.  Your little Joshua will be fine.  Way to go!!!

question: My baby was born on 9-22-05.  I had develop severe preeclampsia and was hospitalized on 9-15 to control my bp which was getting up to 200/110.  I was put on Mag which is some awful stuff.  It made me very ill but help keep my bp down.  Every thing seem to be going well expect the swelling which was so bad that my hands were like balloons as was my belly and face you name it it was swollen.   I had went from 2+ protein in 24 hour urine to 19+ protein which they repeat to verify results.  Then by the the 21st they decided it was time to induce they place the cervical med to soften the cervice it didn't do a thing then the next day I was put on potocin which didn't do a thing then my bp went out of whack.  The poticin was stopped.  I started having trouble breathing.  I keep telling them that I couldn't breath that It was like I was being suffocated.  The nurse keep telling me that I was just upsetting myself and said that I couldn't set up, I felt like I would fight her just to set up because my breathing was worse lying down.  Finally my dr came in and said we have to do a c-section.  I told her we couldn't because I couldn't ly down because I wouldn't be able to breath.  I woke up 3 days later on a ventular.  I had develop Pulmonary Edema and almost died because of the preeclampsia.  Finally got home yesterday.  Joshua was off his ventular before I was and he is doing amazing.  He was 3 lbs 12 ozs at birth and is now 4lbs 2 oz.  He is out of his incumbator and they took the tube out of his belly.  I look forward to his coming home soon. He needs to learn to eat first.
title: Joshua Thomas here 8 weeks early
